channel.title: Forum Development Thread
channel.description:
Project thread for my forum. I want to put the finished product on a portfolio I'll use later on for work! If I really like it I'll make it open source.
Any suggestions? [hr] [completed] -Login/logout/registration system -Ability to start topics / reply -Ability to delete replies -Display #of topics in board -Display #of replies in a topic -Display who last reply was by on Board and Topic -Orders topics by latest reply -Directory for navigating forums (category > topic > reply) -Clean up CSS (upgrade design) [url=http://steadysites.com/login7/img/before-and-after.png][u]Before and After[/u][/url] [i]10/3/2013 12:30AM[/i] -Ability to modify posts [i]11/11/2013 2:24 PM[/i]
[working on it]
[not yet started] -Ability to edit account details -Ability to use BB codes in replies/topic posts -Implement CAPTCHA in user registration, replies and topic posts. -Implement post count -Implement unique rep system -Remove CAPTCHA after 500 post count
[bugs] [color=purple]- No registration validation [FIXED] [i]11/6/2013 9:35AM *Wintercanon[/i][/color] [color=purple]- Double click on reply posts twice [FIXED] [i]9/30/2013 11:31AM *AtomicInt_[/i][/color] [color=purple]- No topic/reply form validation [FIXED] [i]9/30/2013 11:31AM *AtomicInt_[/i][/color] - Probably prone to SQL injections - Probably prone to bot registration
[hr]
All suggestions appreciated!
[url=http://www.SteadySites.com/login7]SteadySites Forum[/url]

item.title: Forum Development Thread
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:32, topic:533252”][quote author=runeite51 link=topic=652047.msg4381682#msg4381682 date=1383767196]

ASP? But why?

Mainly because the point of this project is for me to learn web developing, and to showcase it on my portfolio. I think it’s more impressive to be skilled in both php and asp rather than just php. From what I’ve read, although asp is harder to learn and more costly, it’s an amazing language. On top of that, asp developers are harder to come by, which attributes to a higher salary.

Is there a reason I shouldn’t?
[/quote]

NodeJS is waaaay better. ASP seems outdated these days…[/quote]

I’m sure it is, but I don’t think I have a strong enough grip on JavaScript to learn it.

Read full topic

[/quote]
Mainly because the point of this project is for me to learn web developing, and to showcase it on my portfolio. I think it’s more impressive to be skilled in both php and asp rather than just php. From what I’ve read, although asp is harder to learn and more costly, it’s an amazing language. On top of that, asp developers are harder to come by, which attributes to a higher salary.

item.title: Forum Development Thread
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:15, topic:533252”]Keep us updated.
Anything new?[/quote]
I post all the updates with timestamps now, so if you want to follow my progress it’ll be under [completed].
Thanks for the support!

Wintercanon:

There’s no registration validation.

Woops. Thanks, fixed.

RSCShadow:

My suggestion is to rewrite it in a better language.

PHP is getting a big clustered but my code is still clean enough to stay organized.
If it does start to get out of hand I’ll probably switch over to asp.

Loveandpower:

I’m impressed keep up the great work

Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Development Thread
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

“it’s just a shitty language” isn’t a valid argument.

PHP is terrible though. It almost tries to prevent you from organizing your code properly, it’s conventions are lame, and I often wonder why PHP5 calls itself OOP at all, but whatever.

Some of us, however, have become used to programming in PHP, but that could also attribute to why I suck as a programmer.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Development Thread
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

I concur. http://me.veekun.com/blog/2012/04/09/php-a-fractal-of-bad-design/

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Development Thread
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:18, topic:533252”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=652047.msg4379459#msg4379459 date=1383082256]
My suggestion is to rewrite it in a better language.
[/quote]There’s nothing wrong with writing it in PHP.[/quote]There’s plenty wrong with PHP.

Suppose they should just close down Facebook and rewrite it in Node.js as well?
Facebook uses PHP transcompiled to C++ and then compiled. I'm not suggesting he's going to run into optimization issues with PHP, it's just a shitty language.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Development Thread
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

If Facebook still uses PHP as its backend, it’s probably an extremely optimized version… pretty sure they moved most of their work to native code though.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Development Thread
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:13, topic:533252”]When I replied to my thread I spam clicked the reply button and it posted twice.
You can post empty replies
You can post topics without headers or bodies[/quote]
Thank you. Fixed multiple submits and added some server-side form validation.

Titanium_:

Goodluck with this (: you may want to clean up the design tho. The colors are just to plain.

How does it look now?

tigerclan:

what language are you writing the server code in?

I’m writing it in PHP.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Development Thread
item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

Flame_:

Any progress made so far on the forums? I’ve seen posts made, but it stops there visually.

Well before posting here all I’ve been developing is the backend. Working on frontend now, after I like how it looks I’ll merge the two and continue developing backend.

Register and try it out. All you can do is start a topic, and post/delete your own posts. Let me know if you find a bug, especially if you’re on firefox.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @runeite51 runeite51
item.description:
@runeite51 wrote:

Si Force:

I personally have no problem with you posting your link here, considering that you’re just showcasing your forum that you’re building yourself. As long as it remains that way, I don’t see any problem. Consider your link approved for the moment.

Awesome, thanks! I honestly have no intention of advertising.

Read full topic
